presentations.title: Hardware News - Is ARM Finally Fast Enough?
presentations.abstract: Scott will wade thru some of the current hardware news. Ala: Google making its own Silicon similar to Appleâ€™s M1. The new M1 Macs and the project to get Linux running on the M1 boxes. The company that is making a Linux commuter which is intended for easy user hardware upgrades.
presentations.tweet: Exciting news! Join Scott Granneman on 2021-11-10 for an in-depth look at the latest #hardware trends, including Google's custom Silicon and the new M1 Macs! Don't miss it! #SLUUG @SLUUG_Org https://www.meetup.com/saint-louis-unix-users-group/events/281564704/

presentations.title: Devops (or maybe Opsdev?) Which room are you interested in?
presentations.abstract: A short presentation over my experience in ONUG (Open Networking User Group) meetings.
presentations.tweet: Join us on 2021-11-10 to hear David Forrest share his insights from ONUG meetings. #SLUUG #DevOps #Networking https://www.meetup.com/saint-louis-unix-users-group/events/281564704/

youtubeTitle: Hardware News - Is ARM Finally Fast Enough? | SLUUG 2021-11-10

image.alt: Create a high-resolution, futuristic, and technology-focused image. The design should feature glowing neon grid lines to represent networks, sleek tech devices, and hologram-like effects to convey a cutting-edge vibe. Subtly incorporate logos that signify DevOps-related tools and technologies, open-source networking organizations, leading tech companies' silicon initiatives, new generation computer processors, and a characterized penguin representing Linux. The penguin should be holding a flag with the 'SLUUG' text on it. The overall image should seamlessly blend these elements to evoke a sense of technological advancement and an open-source community spirit.
